qas.question: Which three people were the first to ride the Saturn V rocket into space?

answers.text: Frank Borman, James Lovell, and William Anders

qas.question: What date did Frank Borman, James Lovell, and William Anders leave Earth on the Apollo 8 mission?
During what holiday, was the Apollo 8 mission broadcast from orbit?
Which ocean did the Apolo 8 mission land in?

context: On <a1_0>December 21, 1968<a1_0/>, <a0_0>Frank Borman, James Lovell, and William Anders<a0_0/> became the first humans to ride the Saturn V rocket into space on Apollo 8. They also became the first to leave low-Earth orbit and go to another celestial body, and entered lunar orbit on December 24. They made ten orbits in twenty hours, and transmitted one of the most watched TV broadcasts in history, with their <a2_0>Christmas Eve<a2_0/> program from lunar orbit, that concluded with a reading from the biblical Book of Genesis. Two and a half hours after the broadcast, they fired their engine to perform the first trans-Earth injection to leave lunar orbit and return to the Earth. Apollo 8 safely landed in the <a3_0>Pacific<a3_0/> ocean on December 27, in NASA's first dawn splashdown and recovery.
